Sentencas: The effect of heavy tar compounds on the performance of a Ni-YSZ anode supported solid oxide fuel cell was investigated.
Titulo: The effect of heavy tars (toluene and naphthalene) on the electrochemical performance of an anode-supported SOFC running on bio-syngas

Sentencas: Both toluene and naphthalene were chosen as model compounds and tested separately with a simulated bio-syngas.
Titulo: The effect of heavy tars (toluene and naphthalene) on the electrochemical performance of an anode-supported SOFC running on bio-syngas

Sentencas: Notably, the effect of naphthalene is almost negligible with pure H-2 feed to the SOFC, whereas a severe degradation is observed when using a bio-syngas with an H-2:CO = 1.
Titulo: The effect of heavy tars (toluene and naphthalene) on the electrochemical performance of an anode-supported SOFC running on bio-syngas

Sentencas: The tar compound showed to have a remarkable effect on the inhibition of the WGS shift-reaction, possibly also on the CO direct electro-oxidation at the three-phase-boundary.
Titulo: The effect of heavy tars (toluene and naphthalene) on the electrochemical performance of an anode-supported SOFC running on bio-syngas

Sentencas: An interaction through adsorption of naphthalene on nickel catalytic and electrocatalytic active sites is a plausible explanation for observed degradation and strong performance loss.
Titulo: The effect of heavy tars (toluene and naphthalene) on the electrochemical performance of an anode-supported SOFC running on bio-syngas

Sentencas: Different sites seem to be involved for H-2 and CO electro-oxidation and also with regard to catalytic water gas shift reaction.
Titulo: The effect of heavy tars (toluene and naphthalene) on the electrochemical performance of an anode-supported SOFC running on bio-syngas

Sentencas: Finally, heavy tars (C >= 10) must be regarded as a poison more than a fuel for SOFC applications, contrarily to lighter compounds such benzene or toluene that can directly reformed within the anode electrode.
Titulo: The effect of heavy tars (toluene and naphthalene) on the electrochemical performance of an anode-supported SOFC running on bio-syngas

Sentencas: The presence of naphthalene strongly increases the risk of anode re-oxidation in a syngas stream as CO conversion to H-2 is inhibited and also CH4 conversion is blocked.
Titulo: The effect of heavy tars (toluene and naphthalene) on the electrochemical performance of an anode-supported SOFC running on bio-syngas
